title: Point sources of organics fuel downstream bacteria

content.question: In a river ecosystem, dissolved oxygen concentrations drop quickly downstream from a point-source input of organic matter into the river. This effect is due to

choices.label: increasing populations of mayfly and stonefly larvae
increasing activity of trout and black bass
increasing bacterial activity as organic matter decays
decreasing bacterial activity as turbidity increases
decreasing water temperature as surface evaporation increases

content.answer: increasing bacterial activity as organic matter decays
